snippet: If elected, Nicolás Maduro, the designated successor to Hugo Chávez, must contend with an array of factions, the most important of which is the scandal-plagued military.
abstract: Nicolas Maduro, interim Venezuelan president and designated successor to Hugo Chavez, must contend with array of factions in his transition; most important of these is scandal-plagued military as he inherits a society imbued with military ideals.

byline.contributor: Ginger Thompson contributed reporting from New York, and William Neuman and Paula Ramón from Caracas.

lead_paragraph: If elected, Nicolás Maduro, the designated successor to Hugo Chávez, must contend with an array of factions, the most important of which is the scandal-plagued military.

headline.seo: Chávez Heir Faces Challenge in Relations With the Military
headline.main: Chávez Heir Faces Challenge in Ties With Armed Forces
headline.print_headline: Chávez Heir Faces Challenge in Ties With Armed Forces
